title: Stuck on patching and crashes after a certain amount of time.
body: Something going on with the servers? im stuck at calculating differences, and eventually ends in a crash, same happens when I hit repair the client crashes. Not sure how to go about fixing it, I was logged in fine up until about 10 minutes ago.

replies.body: Yeah i have exactly the same problem except mine is still broken

> [{quoted}](name=Busterlol2000,realm=OCE,application-id=ElA0rvVL,discussion-id=hExAdAiG,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2016-10-14T11:44:02.380+0000)
>
> Yeah i have exactly the same problem except mine is still broken

Im not sure, it could be SIP but I doubt it ,I was downloading and talking on teamspeak+games all day till it fixed. Might have been a server issue too.
yeah.. idek anymore im just gonna cry..
Ok it seems to be fixed now, Patched my client in under 60 seconds. I'd still like to know if it was server side or what, never had that issue before.

Uploading some screens soon of what my client is doing, might give a better indication of the problem. First one is this one, stuck at calculating and has scanned only 1 file, it's no longer stuck and now it's doing a full scan again, im not sure why. But here's the pic anyway:

http://imgur.com/a/yJsxe

Once that finishes it wants to download a 60 mb update but gets stuck on a really slow speed, it's not my internet, I can play other games and im also talking to mates on ts as well and they tell me my quality is fine and im getting no lag, i'ce also watched videos with no buffering issues, ive also ran a speedtest to confirm. Here's the screen for this problem:

http://imgur.com/a/EqOHU

And it hasn't done anything since, it's crashed a few times when I tried to repair and i've tried 2 repairs and no luck.

Heres a screen of my speedtest, ran at 4:12pm AEST: 


http://imgur.com/a/3aNge


Here's the things I tried as solutions:

-Repair (twice) no effect
-Reboot PC
-Load client with and without admin

Im a bit uneasy about trying some of the rads stuff as im not even sure that would have an effect either. Some info from a tech person would be great.
